reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the YMCA for the first time in December of 2005 for about 5 nights. My main concern was bedbugs, but luckily my room didn't have any - I checked the mattress and everything. And reading these recent reviews with rats gives me the creeps! No rats when I was there.
reviews.title: A nice reminder of why I don't live in New York.

likes.disliked: — Roaches and room in need of major rehab.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was moderately clean - there definitely were some areas like behind the door that never get a thorough cleaning. I got a sink in the room, and the shared bathroom was down the hall, and it was pretty clean.
reviews.title: Not recommended...

reviews.text: Progressively though, each night. I would see more and more roaches. The first night, I think was bug free, the second I killed one or two, by the 4th or 5th night, I killed 5 or 6 and I don't think I was exactly looking for them, I just noticed them upon reentering my room.
reviews.title: Good location, Nice reception but.....

reviews.text: The room was very noisy. Garbage trucks were collecting at all hours, and like many other reviewers, my room's window didn't close properly so I had a bit of a draft coming in each night, and lots of noise. My room also had a TV, a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: the worst hotel i've ever stayed in

reviews.text: The staff were nice overall and it stinks that this place isn't _that_ cheap, but hey, it's nyc and you get what you pay for. The location was pretty good, but in the future I'll pony up and pay more to stay in an actual hotel.
reviews.title: Bedbugs

reviews.text: The Vanderbilt YMCA is cheap and near the UN. I also has a great gym and cost less than 100 USD per night in a section where real hotels go for over 300 USD minimum. It would be a great place if it were not for the staff. At check in they could not find my reservation for 30 minutes! They receptionist accused me of falsifying it and refused to look at the electronic email I had confirming it. Only the manager seemed more reasonable and sorted it out ... although by that time they had given up tryng to check me in and told me to lave my bag and come back later to check in.
reviews.title: Impolite and irresponsible staff need replacing or serious improvement

reviews.text: Even worse, on the fourth night of my seven night stay the maid left my room door open and when I returned someone had gone through my room and stolen 400 Swiss Francs that I had left there. When I reported it they were understanding but refused to call to the police. They claimed they had to do their investigation. I made notes on it and told them I would wait until tomorrow before contacting police if they did not do so.
reviews.title: Be carefull with your credit card!!!!

reviews.text: This place is not a hotel. It is hostel with individual rooms with single beds or bunk beds....not good for couples...unless they don't like each too much. For singles or 'just friends' traveling together it is not bad, but unless they get better staff it is a really 'ify' place to stay and could be down right danagerous.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: I stayed at the YMCA for 3 nights, everything was fine, the hotel was ok, not too bad neither good. The problem was when I returned home and got my credit card review. For my VERY surprise I found out that my credit card was used twice at the YMCA desk, one time with my autorization to pay the 3 nights and one more time that I didn't know wich was charged one extra night.
reviews.title: Not the worst, not the best

reviews.text: Just to make it clear, it was used and taken at the same day I checked in, so no reason for charge as late check out, I checked in at the correct date, so no reason to pay extra charge for late check in.
reviews.title: Stayed here as a student group - was still awful

reviews.text: Good Location, 15 minutes walk from Broadway. Good Price as well. My single room was tiny and the bed not the most comfortable in the world but its ok for the price! A Lot of Noise at night, I get a room on the front and was not good. Try to get a room on the back!
reviews.title: Good Location and Good Price

reviews.text: I was in town for the marathon and found the Vanderbilt YMCA to be a good place to stay while here for the race. You can't beat the rate on the room (yes my single room was tiny and the bed not the most comfortable in the world) and I found the hallways, shower rooms and men's bathrooms to be clean and nice. There were a lot of other marathoners staying here also, some who I talked to who have stayed here for many years in a row for the race. They have a pool, which I was anxious to use after the race, but even men were required to wear a swimming cap, which i found very unusual. I plan to stay here again next year - not spending tons of time in the room and for the location and cost, when you compare it to other nearby Manhattan hotels, it is simply a good deal.
reviews.title: Good stay for NYC Marathoner

reviews.text: before i begin. brilliant holiday. But, the hotel!
reviews.title: oh my. what a shambles!

reviews.text: we entered the room, what a reception. shame i can't say the same for the rooms.
reviews.title: I'm too old for this

reviews.text: we walked inn, struggling with the card that didn't work, then finding it hard to fit two suitcases into the cramped room. cracked floor. fuses that didn't work. no room to swing a mouse let alone a cat. one of my friends had an ants nest, another had someone sleeping in his room! double booked. the showers were dirty. hair in the showers, and we had to share! cleaners cleaning to early in the morning. and air con's that just wouldn't work.
reviews.title: Fine for what it is.
Great Hostel in NY City
reviews.text: Before going here I had read a lot of negative reviews. The YMCA turned out wonderful. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. I had called ahead to tell them that I would be arriving late and they should hold my reservation.

reviews.title: Adequate for the price
reviews.text: The room was small but clean. I feel that for the price paid, it was worth it. I know for $85 a night, one can get great accomodation in most cities, but remember that you are in New York. So despite the room being small, there were clean sheets and towels. Shared bath was OK, crowded at times, but manageable and cleaner than described in most reviews.

reviews.title: great for the price
reviews.text: Sheets & towels were changed daily. They also had a luggage storage facility for guests after checking out. This helped us store luggage for a day while we roamed around and picked it up on our way to the airport. Excellent location, 10 mins walk to Times Sqaure.
(Excuse my english) My wife and I had to go
reviews.title: Fine for our needs
Do Not Reserve at this Hostel
reviews.text: to New York for a some tests that she had to do. She'll be in
A pleasant stay and very inexpensive for New York City.
reviews.title: YMCA way to go in the city

reviews.text: I just stayed 3 nights at the Vanderbilt YMCA and was very pleased with the experience. You really can't beat the price when you compare the Y to a regular hotel room. While a conventional hotel stay will offer more privacy and comfort, I chose to save the money and enjoy the city instead.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay at the Vanderbilt YMCA

reviews.text: I have also stayed at the other Manhattan YMCA on the west side, and had the chance to compare both locations. The West Side location costs a little more, (about $119 for a room on their remodeled floors with semi-private baths) and the location is much more convenient to catch the subway. The West Side YMCA is steps away from Central Park, and the bathrooms on the remodeled floors of the West Side YMCA are more private. However, when I stayed there last year, the water for showering was barely lukewarm.
reviews.title: Heaven for USD 65 in downtown NYC!

reviews.text: But back to the Vanderbilt... I found the front desk attendants to be very courteous, the gym is awesome and they offer free wi-fi in the rooms (at times slow and sporadic, but hey... it's included in the room rate)
reviews.title: great place at low price

reviews.text: I occupied a single room that was tiny, but I found it comfortable and clean. It was enough to fulfill my needs. I had a window, a desk, a small fridge, and a nice size t.v. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Being a solo female traveler, I appreciated that there is always an attendant at the front desk monitoring the elevators. You must show your room key card to the attendant before they let you get in.
reviews.title: Loads of facilities, decent enough

reviews.text: This place is a great bargain. I spent 69.00 for a single room with fridge desk and TV. The room was small but clean.. Everything seemed to be freshly painted. Bathroom and showers down the hall--they were adequate..not great. The front desk was super friendly and helpful. You can book your shuttle transportation to the airport here too! Place was full of travelers of all ages and from all over the world. I would definitely stay here again if travelling on a budget.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised

reviews.text: This place has a great location, 5 minute walk to the UN, and 15 minute walk to Times Square. I found the rooms small, simple but clean, the bathrooms were generally clean. It is excellent for the solo traveler. You will have a small bar fridge and TV.
reviews.title: Good location, simple rooms, pity about the impolite staff
Good Accomodation....
reviews.text: Having said that, the staff, particularly the night staff, are so rude. The structure, layout, and design of the hotel's floors/corridors are not that inviting, so much so, that it dampens your stay and has a noticable impact on guests who wont make conversation, and appear to just want to get out as quickly as possible to do their sightseeing. Also, make sure to secure your stuff, the cleaning lady threw away (or maybe stole) my shaving cream and milk. I cannot figure out why she did that. I reported it to the security, who were polite mind you, but could not do much. Don't bother trying to argue with the cleaners, unless you speak Spanish.

Overall, for the price, and location, I would recommend it. You'll be out in NY all day, all night, and just use the hotel for sleep. I found New Yorkers very friendly and helpful, a sad contrast to the YMCA's front desk staff. Because I did a round the world trip, I had to budget carefully, and this was the ideal choice, but if you are just holidaying to New York alone, and especially if you are a couple, then it maybe worthwhile to look for a more upbeat place. But trust me, when it comes to hotel rates, New York's hotel rates will shock you. Even in Tokyo, I found the 3/4 star hotels to be much more affordable than NY's counterparts.
reviews.title: VERY good value for money - with a free gym/swimmingpool!

reviews.text: I travelled to NY in November 2009 and was there for 2 weeks. The hotel was good for the price I paid. In Manhattan, it is very difficult to get an accomodation below $90.00 per day and for that price it was worth it. The shared bathroom facility on each floor was also good. It was always clean and tidy. The janitors used to come everyday to give new towels and clean the room. I did have some problems initially with bed bugs and I complained to the reception. The next day my room was properly cleaned and then did not have any bed bugs problem. There are vending machines on each floor for people who would like to have some snacks or drinks. They provide free Wi-Fi connection too for your period of stay at the YMCA. There is a good laundry room too where you could do oyur own laundry but for ironing your clothes, you would require to have your own iron box or could give to some outside cleaners. There is a supermarket near too where we could buy all necessities. The Grand Central Station and Subway stations are close by making this place convenient for travellers.
reviews.title: Try It and See
